name: MooMambo Farm
description: A dance-heavy dairy farm with cows trained in synchronized mooing.
conflicts: Locked in eternal dispute with Hiccup Hill over cow jazz rights.

name: Snortville Chapel
description: Tiny wooden church where the bellringer accidentally honks instead of ringing.
conflicts: Priest and bell committee fight over how many honks is too many.

name: Scooter Ridge Hamlet
description: A winding village for scooter fanatics and helmet fashionistas.
conflicts: Fierce debate over who owns the only downhill zigzag.

name: Wooligans’ Farm
description: Known for sheep pranks and late-night baa concerts.
conflicts: Accused of hay theft by Nervy Nettle Ranch.

name: EchoRuin Cathedral
description: Crumbling ruins where ghosts practice theatre and shout ‘WHERE’S THE PASTOR?’
conflicts: Ghost hunters argue over echo rights and late-night tours.

name: Snickerstream Camping
description: A giggle-powered riverside campsite with unpredictable frogs.
conflicts: Campers argue over best hammock angles for maximum laughter.

name: Clowncross Junction
description: Town built around a roundabout painted with clown faces.
conflicts: Traffic guards dispute who gets to wear the honk hat.

name: Mouthwhistle Forest Reserve
description: Forest where birds whistle awkward compliments at hikers.
conflicts: Bird watchers argue about who misidentified the Snortbeak.

name: Chatterhog Farm
description: Pigs wear microphones and never shut up.
conflicts: Farmer’s wife vs. the pig union: who gets to speak during dinner?

name: Bouncy Bridge
description: Old wooden bridge that bounces like jelly when walked on.
conflicts: Road officials vs. local pranksters on ‘bounce control’.

name: Quibble Dam
description: A lake dam that reflects your face and your poor decisions.
conflicts: Fishermen argue over who caught the most emotionally unstable trout.

name: Rambling Rock Village
description: Stone cottages where rocks are sorted by tone and sass.
conflicts: Neighbors argue about the loudest pebble.

name: Frizzletop Lodge
description: Cabins for people who can’t stop bouncing their knees.
conflicts: Chef and guests disagree on proper ‘wiggle etiquette’ at dinner.

name: Tadpole Town
description: Houses on stilts shaped like confused tadpoles.
conflicts: Locals fight over who breeds the most charming amphibians.

name: Backwards Barnstead
description: All tools face the wrong way, on purpose.
conflicts: Two founding families argue over who started the backward revolution.

name: Shinewave Chapel
description: Glass church where sunsets cause minor hallucinations.
conflicts: Bishops vs. glass polishers on who gets to sparkle more.

name: Boingville Wetlands
description: Mossy marshland that bounces. Nobody knows why. It just does.
conflicts: Scientists vs. the village knitting club over naming rights.

name: Cackle Nest Farm
description: Chickens gossip non-stop. Eggs may contain rumors.
conflicts: Farmhands argue over who teaches the hens stand-up comedy.

name: Crunchchapel
description: Small chapel with crushing acoustics and louder blessings.
conflicts: Priest and choir clash over mic settings every Sunday.

name: Mumblefield Ski Slope
description: Ski hill where everyone mumbles advice as they crash.
conflicts: Ski school vs. lift operators on the number of snack breaks.

name: Gossip Gully Farm
description: Where beetles know your business before you do.
conflicts: Bug watchers and berry pickers clash over rumor regulation.

name: Crumplefjord Fishery
description: Fishermen dry their fish by folding them into origami.
conflicts: Ongoing dispute over who caught the crunchiest cod.

name: Snortville Market Grounds
description: Once a mine, now a market with odd smells and louder customers.
conflicts: Miners vs. mango vendors on stall location fairness.

name: Gigglewheel Watermill
description: The river makes giggly noises as it spins the mill.
conflicts: Miller vs. environmentalists over ‘snicker runoff levels’.

name: Snufflepig Training Grounds
description: Farm where pigs are trained for nonsense agility drills.
conflicts: Trainer disputes over whose pig did the best triple snort.
